title: 美國民主黨將通過大選政綱: 對華要強硬但仍需共同合作

replies.msg:
今個禮拜係美國民主黨全國黨大會，咁民主黨就會作出終極投票，確定派出拜登作為候選人同埋確立大選政綱其實民主黨喺7月27號就完成起草今次大選政綱，依家只係俾全國黨大會作最後象徵性表決 (雖然亦有黨員一早話會投反對票)

而共和黨方面，可能係因為爭取連任，一早講咗會沿用翻2016年嘅政綱，但都仲要等24-27號黨大會先知會唔會有字眼上嘅更新，但整體而言，方向應該不變，而且睇共和黨過去四年嘅實際表現，有可能仲好過睇政綱，所以依家就可以對比兩黨政綱

大家睇下面民主黨2020政綱，入面係完全無提到會執行7月14號通過嘅《香港自治法》，只係提到會全力執行舊年通過嘅《香港人權及民主法》，到底係唔夠時間加入相關內容定點呢? 就大家可以再討論

但有香港，就一定唔少得台灣，共和黨由2000年大選政綱開始，每次都會提到協防台灣，今次亦都唔例外，而民主黨就一向無嘅，反而呢，民主黨今次政綱其中一個好強調嘅方向係「反戰 (ending forever wars)」，而且民主黨相信中國帶來嘅挑戰並唔係主要軍事方面嘅 (Democrats believe the China challenge is not primarily a military one)，但都有補充會阻止同應對中國嘅侵略咁話 (deter and respond to aggression)

但得意嘅係，民主黨由2000年嘅大選政綱開始，次次都有提及一個嘅中國原則 (One China Policy)，今次就搵唔到依個字眼

整體而言，民主黨今次政綱有唔少地方提到中國，而大方向都係話，要連同其他國家一齊面對中國，但就唔要發動關稅戰同冷戰，要同中國就氣候及武器擴散等方面共同合作

唔知大家點睇美國民主黨今次嘅政綱呢

=節錄=
民主黨2020政綱提到香港3次，總共2句
Rather than stand with President Xi Jinping as he cracks down on Hong Kong’s autonomy, Democrats will stand for the democratic rights of its citizens. We will fully enforce the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, including by sanctioning officials, financial institutions, companies, and individuals responsible for undercutting Hong Kong’s autonomy.

共和黨2016/20政綱提到香港1次，總共唔夠一句
Meanwhile, cultural genocide continues in Tibet and Xinjiang, the promised autonomy of Hong Kong is eroded, the currency is manipulated, our technology is stolen, and intellectual property and copyrights are mocked in an economy based on piracy.

民主黨2020政綱提到台灣2次，總共1句
Democrats are committed to the Taiwan Relations Act and will continue to support a peaceful resolution of cross-strait issues consistent with the wishes and best interests of the people of Taiwan.

共和黨2016/20政綱提到台灣9次，總共5句
We salute the people of Taiwan, with whom we share the values of democracy, human rights, a free market economy, and the rule of law. Our relations will continue to be based upon the provisions of the Taiwan Relations Act, and we affirm the Six Assurances given to Taiwan in 1982 by President Reagan. We oppose any unilateral steps by either side to alter the status quo in the Taiwan Straits on the principle that all issues regarding the island’s future must be resolved peacefully, through dialogue, and be agreeable to the people of Taiwan. If China were to violate those principles, the United States, in accord with the Taiwan Relations Act, will help Taiwan defend itself. We praise efforts by the new government in Taipei to continue constructive relations across the Taiwan Strait and call on China to reciprocate. As a loyal friend of America, Taiwan has merited our strong support, including free trade agreement status, the timely sale of defensive arms including technology to build diesel submarines, and full participation in the World Health Organization, International Civil Aviation Organization, and other multilateral institutions.

民主黨2020政綱反對冷戰要合作
Democrats will pursue this strategy without resorting to self-defeating, unilateral tariff wars or falling into the trap of a new Cold War. Those mistakes would only serve to exaggerate China’s weight, over-militarize our policy, and hurt American workers.

America must approach our relationship with China with confidence—the confidence to lead international efforts to push back on malign behavior while also pursuing cooperation on issues of mutual interest like climate change and nonproliferation and ensuring that the U.S.-China rivalry does not put global stability at risk.
